description: Triangle of numbers related to A000330 (sum of squares) and A000364 (Euler numbers).
comments: Row sums give A060059. Columns give A000012 (powers of 1), A000330 (sum of squares), A060060-2 for m=0,...,4. Main diagonal gives Euler numbers A000364. See triangle A060074.
formula: a(n, m) = a(n-1, m)+((n+1-m)^2)*a(n, m-1), a(n, -1) := 0, a(0, 0)=1, a(n, m)=0 if n<m.a(n, m)= ay(n-m+1, m) if n >= m >= 0, with the rectangular array ay(n, m) := sum((j^2)*ay(j+1, m-1), j=1..n), n >= 0, m >= 1; input: ay(n, 0)=1 (iterated sums of squares).G.f. for m-th column: 1/(1-x) for m=0, (x^m)*sum(A060063(m, k)*x^k, k=0..m)/(1-x)^(3*m+1), m >= 1.Recursion for g.f.s for m-th column: (1-x)*G(m, x)= x*G''(m-1, x)- G'(m-1, x) + G(m-1, x)/x, m>=2; G(1, x)=x*(1+x)/(1-x)^4; the apostrophe denotes differentiation w.r.t. x. G(0, x)=1/(1-x). (W. Lang, added Feb 13 2004.)
author: _Wolfdieter Lang_, Mar 16 2001
